verses.text: And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken diligently unto the voice of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, to observe \add and\add* to do all his commandments which I command thee \add this\add* day, that the \sc Lord\sc* thy God will set thee on high above all nations of the earth:
and all these blessings shall come on thee, and overtake thee, if thou shalt hearken unto the voice of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God.
Blessed \add shalt\add* thou \add be\add* in the city, and blessed \add shalt\add* thou \add be\add* in the field.
Blessed \add shall be\add* the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy ground, and the fruit of thy cattle, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.
Blessed \add shall be\add* thy basket and thy store.
Blessed \add shalt\add* thou \add be\add* when thou comest in, and blessed \add shalt\add* thou \add be\add* when thou goest out.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall cause thine enemies that rise up against thee \add to be\add* smitten before thy face: they shall come out against thee one way, and flee before thee seven ways.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall command the blessing upon thee in thy storehouses, and in all that thou settest thine hand unto; and he shall bless thee in the land which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall establish thee a holy people unto himself, as he hath sworn unto thee, if thou shalt keep the commandments of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, and walk in his ways.
And all people of the earth shall see that thou art called by the name of the \sc Lord\sc*; and they shall be afraid of thee.

And the \sc Lord\sc* shall make thee plenteous in goods, in the fruit of thy body, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy ground, in the land which the \sc Lord\sc* sware unto thy fathers to give thee.

The \sc Lord\sc* shall open unto thee his good treasure, the heaven to give the rain unto thy land in his season, and to bless all the work of thine hand: and thou shalt lend unto many nations, and thou shalt not borrow.

And the \sc Lord\sc* shall make thee the head, and not the tail; and thou shalt be above only, and thou shalt not be beneath; if that thou hearken unto the commandments of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, which I command thee \add this\add* day, to observe and to do \add them:\add*
and thou shalt not go aside from any of the words which I command thee \add this\add* day, \add to\add* the right hand, or \add to\add* the left, to go after other gods to serve them.

But it shall come to pass, if thou wilt not hearken unto the voice of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes which I command thee \add this\add* day; that all these curses shall come upon thee, and overtake thee:
cursed \add shalt\add* thou \add be\add* in the city, and cursed \add shalt\add* thou \add be\add* in the field.
Cursed \add shall be\add* thy basket and thy store.
Cursed \add shall be\add* the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy land, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.
Cursed \add shalt\add* thou \add be\add* when thou comest in, and cursed \add shalt\add* thou \add be\add* when thou goest out.

The \sc Lord\sc* shall send upon thee cursing, vexation, and rebuke, in all that thou settest thine hand unto for to do, until thou be destroyed, and until thou perish quickly; because of the wickedness of thy doings, where\add by\add* thou hast forsaken me.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall make the pestilence cleave unto thee, until he have consumed thee from off the land, whither thou goest to possess it.

The \sc Lord\sc* shall smite thee with a consumption, and with a fever, and with an inflammation, and with an extreme burning, and with the sword, and with blasting, and with mildew; and they shall pursue thee until thou perish.
And thy heaven that \add is\add* over thy head shall be brass, and the earth that \add is\add* under thee \add shall be\add* iron.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall make the rain of thy land powder and dust: from heaven shall it come down upon thee, until thou be destroyed.

The \sc Lord\sc* shall cause thee \add to be\add* smitten before thine enemies: thou shalt go out one way against them, and flee seven ways before them: and shalt be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth.
And thy carcase shall be meat unto all fowls of the air, and unto the beasts of the earth, and no man shall fray \add them\add* away.
The \sc Lord\sc* will smite thee with the botch of Egypt, and with the emerods, and with the scab, and with the itch, where\add of\add* thou canst not be healed.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall smite thee with madness, and blindness, and astonishment of heart:

and thou shalt grope at noondays, as the blind gropeth in darkness, and thou shalt not prosper in thy ways: and thou shalt be only oppressed and spoiled evermore, and no man shall save \add thee\add*.
Thou shalt betroth a wife, and another man shall lie with her: thou shalt build a house, and thou shalt not dwell therein: thou shalt plant a vineyard, and shalt not gather the grapes thereof.

Thine ox \add shall be\add* slain before thine eyes, and thou shalt not eat thereof: thine ass \add shall be\add* violently taken away from before thy face, and shall not be restored to thee: thy sheep \add shall be\add* given unto thine enemies, and thou shalt have none to rescue \add them\add*.

Thy sons and thy daughters \add shall be\add* given unto another people, and thine eyes shall look, and fail \add with longing\add* for them all the day long: and \add there shall be\add* no might in thine hand.
The fruit of thy land, and all thy labours, shall a nation which thou knowest not eat up; and thou shalt be only oppressed and crushed alway:
so that thou shalt be mad for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall smite thee in the knees, and in the legs, with a sore botch that cannot be healed, from the sole of thy foot unto the top of thy head.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall bring thee, and thy king which thou shalt set over thee, unto a nation which neither thou nor thy fathers have known; and there shalt thou serve other gods, wood and stone.
And thou shalt become an astonishment, a proverb, and a byword, among all nations whither the \sc Lord\sc* shall lead thee.
Thou shalt carry much seed out \add into\add* the field, and shalt gather \add but\add* little in; for the locust shall consume it.
Thou shalt plant vineyards, and dress \add them\add*, but shalt neither drink \add of\add* the wine, nor gather \add the grapes;\add* for the worms shall eat them.
Thou shalt have olive trees throughout all thy coasts, but thou shalt not anoint \add thyself with\add* the oil; for thine olive shall cast \add his fruit\add*.
Thou shalt beget sons and daughters, but thou shalt not enjoy them; for they shall go into captivity.
All thy trees and fruit of thy land shall the locust consume.
The stranger that \add is\add* within thee shall get up above thee very high; and thou shalt come down very low.
He shall lend to thee, and thou shalt not lend to him: he shall be the head, and thou shalt be the tail.

Moreover all these curses shall come upon thee, and shall pursue thee, and overtake thee, till thou be destroyed; because thou hearkenedst not unto the voice of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which he commanded thee:
and they shall be upon thee for a sign and for a wonder, and upon thy seed for ever.
Because thou servedst not the \sc Lord\sc* thy God with joyfulness, and with gladness of heart, for the abundance of all \add things;\add*

therefore shalt thou serve thine enemies which the \sc Lord\sc* shall send against thee, in hunger, and in thirst, and in nakedness, and in want of all \add things:\add* and he shall put a yoke of iron upon thy neck, until he have destroyed thee.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall bring a nation against thee from far, from the end of the earth, \add as swift\add* as the eagle flieth; a nation whose tongue thou shalt not understand;
a nation of fierce countenance, which shall not regard the person of the old, nor shew favour to the young:

and he shall eat the fruit of thy cattle, and the fruit of thy land, until thou be destroyed: which \add also\add* shall not leave thee \add either\add* corn, wine, or oil, \add or\add* the increase of thy kine, or flocks of thy sheep, until he have destroyed thee.

And he shall besiege thee in all thy gates, until thy high and fenced walls come down, wherein thou trustedst, throughout all thy land: and he shall besiege thee in all thy gates throughout all thy land, which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath given thee.

And thou shalt eat the fruit of thine own body, the flesh of thy sons and of thy daughters, which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath given thee, in the siege, and in the straitness, wherewith thine enemies shall distress thee:

\add so that\add* the man \add that is\add* tender among you, and very delicate, his eye shall be evil toward his brother, and toward the wife of his bosom, and towards the remnant of his children which he shall leave:

so that \add he\add* will not give to any of them of the flesh of his children whom he shall eat: because he hath nothing left him in the siege, and in the straitness, wherewith thine enemies shall distress thee in all thy gates.

The tender and delicate \add woman\add* among you, which would not adventure to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delicateness and tenderness, her eye shall be evil towards the husband of her bosom, and towards her son, and towards her daughter,

and towards her young one that cometh out from between her feet, and towards her children which she shall bear: for she shall eat them for want of all \add things\add* secretly in the siege and straitness, wherewith thine enemy shall distress thee in thy gates.
If thou wilt not observe to do all the words of this law that are written in this book, that \add thou\add* mayest fear this glorious and fearful name, THE LORD THY GOD;
then the \sc Lord\sc* will make thy plagues wonderful, and the plagues of thy seed, \add even\add* great plagues, and of long continuance, and sore sicknesses, and of long continuance.
Moreover he will bring upon thee all the diseases of Egypt, which thou wast afraid of; and they shall cleave unto thee.
Also every sickness, and every plague, which \add is\add* not written in the book of this law, them will the \sc Lord\sc* bring upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
And ye shall be left few in number, whereas ye were as the stars of heaven for multitude; because thou wouldest not obey the voice of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God.

And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* as the \sc Lord\sc* rejoiced over you to do you good, and to multiply you; so the \sc Lord\sc* will rejoice over you to destroy you, and to bring you to nought; and ye shall be plucked from off the land whither thou goest to possess it.

And the \sc Lord\sc* shall scatter thee among all people, from the \add one\add* end of the earth even unto the other; and there thou shalt serve other gods, which neither thou nor thy fathers have known, \add even\add* wood and stone.
And among these nations shalt thou find no ease, neither shall the sole of thy foot have rest: but the \sc Lord\sc* shall give thee there a trembling heart, and failing of eyes, and sorrow of mind:
and thy life shall hang in doubt before thee; and thou shalt fear day and night, and shalt have none assurance of thy life:

in the morning thou shalt say, Would God it were even! and at even thou shalt say, Would God it were morning! for the fear of thine heart where\add with\add* thou shalt fear, and for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.

And the \sc Lord\sc* shall bring thee \add into\add* Egypt again with ships, by the way where\add of\add* I spake unto thee, Thou shalt see it no more again: and there ye shall be sold unto your enemies for bondmen and bondwomen, and no man shall buy \add you\add*.
